Sure, here is a summary of the training programs and drills that have been suggested in this thread:

1. White belt to blue belt BJJ training program:
* Week 1: Guard position
* Week 2: Side control position
* Week 3: Closed guard position
* Week 4: Half guard position
* Week 5: Knee-on-belly position
* Week 6: Mount position
* Week 7: Mount position
* Week 8: Back control
* Week 9: Takedowns
* Week 10: Passes
* Week 11: Submissions
* Week 12: Transitions
* Week 13: Drilling
* Week 14: Sparring
* Week 15: Conditioning
* Additional weeks:
* Week 16: Mount position
* Week 17: Back control
* Week 18: Takedowns
* Week 19: Passes
* Week 20: Submissions
2. Four-week training program focused on submissions, grips, and the kimura:
* Week 1: Fundamentals of submissions
* Week 2: Gi grips and control
* Week 3: Kimura attacks and defenses
* Week 4: Sparring and drilling
3. Revised four-week training program focused on collar chokes, chokes, and strangles:
* Week 1: Fundamentals of collar chokes
* Week 2: Gi grips and control
* Week 3: Chokes and strangles
* Week 4: Theory and visualization
4. Good drills for BJJ that can be performed at home:
* Shrimping
* Knee cutters
* Bridge and roll
* Guard retention

Remember to always warm up before training, and to listen to your body and take regular breaks to avoid injury. Also, be sure to continue learning and improving your skills and techniques in BJJ, and enjoy the journey of growth and self-improvement.
